greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Size of the cycle containing n in the map x -> usigma(x)-x or 0 if n is not a member of any finite cycle. Here usigma is the sum of unitary divisors of n (A034448).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 1..100000
example: Because A034460(90) = 90, a(90) = 1. Because A034460(78) = 90, a(78) = 0, as even though 78 ends into a cycle of one, it itself is not a part of that cycle.
program: A034460(n) = (sumdivmult(n, d, if(gcd(d, n/d)==1, d))-n); \\ From A034460
A327159(n,orgn=n,xs=Set([])) = if(1==n,0,if(vecsearch(xs,n), if(n==orgn,length(xs),0), xs = setunion([n],xs); A327159(A034460(n),orgn,xs)));
xref: Cf. A002827 (positions of ones), A063991 (of 2's), A319902 (of 4's), A097024 (of 5's), A319917 (of 6's), A319937 (of 10's), A097030 (of 14's), A327157 (of all nonzero terms).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 28 2019
